reviewText: I bought this DVD on a whim and to be honest because my partner likes independent films and I think it has male nudity as well. I have not seen the other two previous films by Eric Schaeffer , but I honestly have to say that we enjoyed this movie. It sort of reminds me of "Running With Scissors" in the way that it is loosely based on the writers life, Augusten Burroughs. However, Running With Scissors is one of my all time favorites when it comes to films of this type.Again, we have a very broad spectrum of films and subject matter that we enjoy watching. It is worth the time to view this if you get a chance. It may be a little shocking to some and Ii have to say that "Wirey" comes off as being very conceited, but we are glad we picked up a copy of the film.
summary: The only way I know to disciple this film is "Very Interesting"

reviewText: If the world liked Eric Schaeffer as much as Eric Schaeffer likedEric Schaeffer, every univeristy and private college in North America would have its own General ed Western-civ course on this director's work. This man's self delusion reaches to such levels of grandeur it is almost like witnessing a natural wonder such as the Aurora Borealis or a solar eclipse. He is so amazing in his confidence that one can not look away, despite the hackneyed content. He is a cinematic Hitler.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wirey Spindell, a film I was not even sure I wanted to see, surprised me.  I've only seen "If Lucy Fell" which, well, I didn't much like (Sarah Jessica Parker and Elle McPherson and it still didn't work for me).  This movie, tries too hard perhaps, but was really affecting.  Schaffer has something to say.  Critics, and most did not like this film, bemoan his lack of of success.  I applaud him for his film.  It is a gutsy and adult film.  He shares his life with us and it isn't pretty.  It is consistently interesting and at times, a bit moving.  Not crying moving, but you do feel for Wirey.  It is brillant?  No.  But considering all the junk coming from mainstream Hollywood these days, I enjoyed the 1hr 40min.  I applaude someone who can put themselves out there like this.  It worth seeing to enjoy the performances of Eric Mobius and Samantha Buck (who? You should know her soon enough) who are both excellent.  Samanta Buck is a revelation.  As to the film itself,I think Kevin Thomas of the LA Times said it well.  ""Wirey Spindell" may be too heady for some tastes but can stir you deeply, if you're open to it."  If you don't want to listen to me, he is a pretty darned well respected film critic.  Enjoy.
Title: N/A
